TopicTitle: After docking, vessel controls backwards. Huh?

Articles.Content:
This is a biome hopper plus lab. It's supposed to do a comprehensive survey of both Mun & Minmus. There are two slight problems:

  1. whenever I switch to the vessel, I have to do a "Control from here" on any command pod, or I will fly in the wrong direction. It was not always thus, only after the first docking. Please note that it's not enough to do it once. Every time I do a scene change to this vessel, it will again be oriented backwards. Never had that before.
  2. also since the first docking, it will insist on drawing fuel from the lander tanks, and only the lander tanks. That's the two 400unit thingies close to the engine. If those are dry, the engine is out of fuel. The big tank on top of the lab ought to have a very direct connection all the way to the engine, and the docking ports in between allow crossfeed, yet that doesn't matter: if the small radial engines are empty or locked, the engine will be fuel deprived.

If anyone happens to know a workaround for either issue, of how I can avoid it on future vessels, I'd be all ears.
